Module count
Package count.gui.kit

Class TableScroll.SortSelectionSynchronizer

java.lang.Object
count.gui.kit.TableScroll.SortSelectionSynchronizer
All Implemented Interfaces:
EventListener, ListSelectionListener, RowSorterListener
Enclosing class:
TableScroll<TMODEL extends AbstractTableModel>
public class TableScroll.SortSelectionSynchronizer
extends Object
implements RowSorterListener, ListSelectionListener
This class recovers the selection after the displayed row order changes in a JTable. This RowSorterListener should be added to a RowSorter before it is set for a table. When two JTables use the same sorter and selection model, they both attempt to restore the selection after a row sorting events: the end result after two "corrections" may be wrong (selection does change). This is the situation when frozen row headers are in one JTable and the other scrollable JTable displays the scrollable columns. The solution assumes that at sorting a RowSorterEvent with Type.SORT_ORDER_CHANGED is generated, which is followed by another RowSorterEvent of Type.SORTED.
Author:
csuros
